content.raw:
Adding in Erase using an ID: f6963bd. It still needs work.

I don't see this as breaking ECS. Adding inheritance is one way to break the goals of ECS.  There is nothing wrong with adding functionality, like deleting or accessing entities based on a name. Our use case makes heavy use of names, and we should give users access to entities based on that fact.

Gazebo is currently lacking an API that provides introspection and manipulation of the internals. Imagine you use gazebo as a library and load a world file. How do you get access to the entities? The Server API will likely grow quite a bit in order to support downstream users.
